title: Rumbling with Vulnerability
summary: Engage in honest conversations about emotions and fears to build courage and connection.

details.content: Vulnerability is the birthplace of courage, creativity, and trust. Rumbling with vulnerability means facing uncertainty, risk, and emotional exposure, which are essential for authentic leadership and meaningful relationships.
A leader admits to their team that they don’t have all the answers about a new project, inviting input and collaboration rather than pretending to be certain.

content: Acknowledge your emotions and name them.
Ask open-ended questions to explore feelings and perspectives.
Practice active listening without judgment.
Share your own uncertainties and mistakes.
Set boundaries to ensure psychological safety.

title: Living into Our Values
summary: Identify and act in alignment with your core values, even when it’s difficult.

details.content: Clarity of values guides decision-making and behavior, especially under pressure. Living into your values builds integrity, trust, and resilience.
When pressured to cut corners on a project, a leader stands firm on the value of honesty, choosing transparency over expediency.

content: Identify your top two core values.
Reflect on how your daily actions align with these values.
Communicate your values to your team.
Use your values as a filter for tough decisions.
Hold yourself and others accountable to shared values.

title: Braving Trust
summary: Build and maintain trust through consistent behaviors and clear boundaries.

details.content: Trust is the foundation of effective teams and organizations. It is built in small moments and can be broken by breaches in integrity, reliability, or respect.
A manager consistently follows through on promises and admits when they make a mistake, reinforcing trust with their team.

content: Be reliable—do what you say you’ll do.
Respect confidentiality and boundaries.
Own your mistakes and apologize when needed.
Be generous in your interpretations of others’ actions.
Communicate clearly and honestly.

title: Learning to Rise
summary: Develop resilience by recognizing setbacks, owning your stories, and rising strong after failures.

details.content: Failure and disappointment are inevitable. Learning to rise means developing the skills to recover, learn, and grow from setbacks, which is essential for innovation and leadership.
After a failed product launch, a team debriefs openly about what went wrong, learns from the experience, and applies those lessons to future projects.

content: Recognize and acknowledge your emotional responses to setbacks.
Challenge the stories you tell yourself about failure.
Seek feedback and support from trusted colleagues.
Practice self-compassion and patience.
Identify actionable lessons and move forward with intention.
